answers.answer: Hello,Frequent urination can be due to excessive intake of liquids, diuretic substances (including tea, caffeine, alcohol, certain drugs), anxiety, exposure to cold, diabetes mellitus, diabetes insipidus (central or nephrogenic), urinary tract infections or obstruction, etc to name a few more common ones. I suggest you to take opinion of your doctor who would do a clinical examination and advice for needful tests.I hope it helps. Take care and regards

question: For about two weeks I have a had a feeling of needing to urinate frequently, sometimes with very mild pain felt in the penis. I vistited my MD and he tested my urine (results were fine, no infection, no blood, sugar was ok) and checked my lower back and abs for pain (none). I do sleep though the night and my stream is good. No feeling of "sitting on a ball".  He ruled our prostate issues and said it was likely and irritated bladder from supplements or stress. The sensation is not constant and only makes me feel like I need to urinate, even if I recently went. In fact, when I really need to go (like first thing in morning) the feeling is muted compared with how I normally felt. Is this related to too many orgasims - PC muscle issues? I have no issues regarding sex- it been fine . no premature ejuaculations etc. I can have sex with no pain but is it possible I damaged somthing down there?
title: feeling of frequent urination
